text:
Currently the timezone indicator in log lines in access log file look like this:

127.0.0.1 - - [28/Mar/2003:11:21:46 2000] "POST /myservlet HTTP/1.1" 200 -

In order to have RFC 822 compliant timezone value this line should look like this:

127.0.0.1 - - [28/Mar/2003:11:21:46 +2000] "POST /myservlet HTTP/1.1" 200 -

Any reason not to have it this way?
creator: sven.filatov@aqris.com

text:
Firstly.  The original bug report has an error.

The example log line should be + 2 hours.  Not + 20.  Two problems in fact.  One
is the missing +, and the other is the added 0 in the wrong place.  

It should be

127.0.0.1 - - [28/Mar/2003:11:21:46 +0200] "POST /myservlet HTTP/1.1" 200 -

The original code obviously assumes noone runs webservers east of Greenwich. :)

Also using DateFormat would include daylight savings, and possibly convert to a
three letter string e.g. EST, EET, CST etc

This should be fixed in 5.  (like the resolved duplicate) The patch recommended
was not used, but the end result should be correct. I have the port in place
(locally) for 4.1 but haven't committed it yet (need to perform simple
regression tests first)

Marking as resolved since this is fixed in 5 and should be ported (read: copied)
very soon (by me) back to 4.1.

If the behavior in 5 for AccessLogValve with respect to timezone is not correct-
reopen this report - and I'll get the notification.
